operations.notes:
Return all LanguageData values associated with the identified application.

This operation returns a Language Wrapper with the following fields:

Name Data Type Description
languageDatas List of Language Data values Each Language Data value describes a language name and country for display and language settings purposes.

responseMessages.message:
Unrecoverable Error

A System Exception is returned if the operation has caused an unrecoverable state.

operations.notes:
Return all time zones associated with the application.

This operation returns a AQ Time Zone Wrapper with the following fields:

Name Data Type Description
timezones List of AQTimeZone values Time Zone information for availability and reservation scheduling.

responseMessages.message:
Unrecoverable Error

A System Exception is returned if the operation has caused an unrecoverable state.

operations.notes:
Creates a TimeZone value. A TimeZone value must use a unique name and TZvalue that is recognized as a java.util.TimeZone ID value.

Note: This operation may only be performed by System Administrators.

This operation requires a AQTimeZone value.

This operation returns a AQTimeZone value.

responseMessages.message:
Unauthorized User

If the requesting User does not have permissions to update TimeZones or the User Authentication Token is invalid, the following exceptions are returned:

  • Authentication Exception if the requestor cannot be authenticated using the provided Authentication token
  • Authorization Exception if the requestor identified by the Authorization token is not authorized to perform this action.

TimeZone Not Found

If the TimeZone identified cannot be found, the following exception is returned:

  • Not Found Exception if the TimeZone cannot be found.

Validation Failure

If the TimeZone Name is not unique, the following exception is returned:

  • Duplicate Exception if the Name is not unique.

Unrecoverable Error

A System Exception is returned if the operation has caused an unrecoverable state.

operations.notes:
Update an existing TimeZone value. A TimeZone value must use a unique name and TZvalue that is recognized as a java.util.TimeZone ID value.

Note: This operation may only be performed by System Administrators.

This operation requires a AQTimeZone value.

This operation returns a AQTimeZone value.

responseMessages.message:
Unauthorized User

If the requesting User does not have permissions to update TimeZones or the User Authentication Token is invalid, the following exceptions are returned:

  • Authentication Exception if the requestor cannot be authenticated using the provided Authentication token
  • Authorization Exception if the requestor identified by the Authorization token is not authorized to perform this action.

TimeZone Not Found

If the TimeZone identified cannot be found, the following exception is returned:

  • Not Found Exception if the TimeZone cannot be found.

Validation Failure

If the TimeZone Name is not unique, the following exception is returned:

  • Duplicate Exception if the Name is not unique.

Unrecoverable Error

A System Exception is returned if the operation has caused an unrecoverable state.
